_comment: LXGIC Clipper — OpenClaw Cron Templates. Copy and customize for your setup.

templates.name: clipper-monitor-15min
templates.description: Monitor a livestream every 15 minutes. Records a segment, detects highlights, clips them, and posts to social platforms. Best for active/popular streams.
templates.notes: Adjust CLIPPER_STREAM_URL and POSTIZ_API_KEY. Threshold 70 is a good starting point — lower for more clips, higher for fewer but better clips.

templates.name: clipper-monitor-30min
templates.description: Monitor every 30 minutes. Good balance of coverage and resource usage. Best for most use cases.
templates.notes: Records 15-minute segments every 30 minutes. Max 3 clips per run, 10 per day.

templates.name: clipper-livecheck-only
templates.description: Only check if stream is live. Does NOT clip. Useful for monitoring when a streamer goes live.
templates.notes: Lightweight — just checks if the stream is online. Pair with a webhook or notification to trigger clipping.

templates.name: clipper-scheduled-posts
templates.description: Record and clip, but schedule posts for peak engagement times instead of posting immediately.
templates.notes: Runs every 2 hours. Higher threshold (80) for quality. Schedule 'auto' uses Postiz optimal timing.

templates.name: clipper-dry-run
templates.description: Test run — records, detects, and clips but does NOT post. Good for tuning your threshold.
templates.notes: Dry run mode — saves clips locally at ~/.lxgic-clipper/clips/ without posting. Review clips and adjust threshold.

instructions: 1. Choose a template above that fits your use case
2. Replace YOUR_STREAMER with the actual stream URL
3. Replace 'your-postiz-api-key' with your real Postiz API key
4. Create the cron job in OpenClaw:
5. Or run setup.sh for interactive configuration first
tips: Start with dry-run to test and tune your threshold
Threshold 60-70: More clips, some may be lower quality
Threshold 75-85: Balanced — good for most streamers
Threshold 85-100: Very selective — only the best moments
